decision_conditions: The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 as the applicant has failed to demonstrate, given the potential occupancy levels within the property, that the maximum number of residents would be no more than 6 in total.

The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class B Condition B.2(a) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 as the materials used in the construction of the rear dormer are not of a similar appearance to those used in the construction of the exterior of the existing dwellinghouse.

The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 as the applicant has failed to demonstrate, that given the internal layout with amenities to allow for a separate self contained living accommodation on the ground and upper floors, that the proposal would not be used as two separate residential units.

The rear dormer as constructed is different to the proposed elevations in terms of its width and the window sizes and placement. The proposed elevations therefore are inaccurate and not representative of the development that has been carried out.
description: Conversion of roof space to habitable use to include rear dormer. Change of use from Class C3 (Dwelling) to Class C4 (Small HMO) (Application for a Certificate of Lawful Development for a Proposed Development)
